page.title: 06Transport
page.content: Most families in the valley own a {car.}Ulverston and Ambleside are the nearest shopping centres which are about 11 miles away. Some people like to go to bigger towns like Lancaster, Kendal and Barrow. There is an alternative to using a car and that is the{postbus.}The postbus is a red post office van which delivers the letters and it also carries pasengers. It comes twice a day.The post bus is licensed to carry up to 11 pasengers. It will pick you up or drop you off anywhere along its route. On school days you can catch the{large bus}which takes the secondary school children to Ulverston. Old people are often given lifts by friends who have cars. They also have outings by bus paid for by Age Concern and the OAP committee.
